{{velocity}} #if ($doc.fullName == 'CKEditor.ContentSheet') This is the sheet used to obtain the content that is passed to the [[CKEditor>>http://ckeditor.com/]]. #else {{html clean="false"}} ## We don't have a HTML5 parser yet so we use XHTML 1.0 header. ## Hook for inserting Link extensions. This will be replaced with the pulled link references. ## Fix some issues caused by the fact that we put the content directly under the BODY element. #set ($discard = $xwiki.ssx.use('CKEditor.ContentSheet')) ## Include the stylesheets that affect the content in view mode. #template("stylesheets.vm") #if ($xwiki.getDocument('CKEditor.Config').getValue('loadJavaScriptSkinExtensions') == 1) #template("javascript.vm") #end #if (!$source) #set ($source = $tdoc) #end #set ($serializedSpaceReference = $services.model.serialize($source.documentReference.parent, 'local')) ## #if ($source.html) #set ($html = $services.wysiwyg.parseAndRender($source.html, $source.syntax.toIdString())) #else #set ($html = $services.wysiwyg.toAnnotatedXHTML($source.content, $source.syntax.toIdString())) #end ## Escape {{ in the rendered content to be sure that the HTML macro is not closed unintentionally. ## The result must be unescaped before being passed to the CKEditor as input. ## CKEDITOR-134: Unclosed {{html}} results in addition of closing tag even when macro isn't actually evaluated #set ($output = $html.replace('{{', '{{')) #if ("$!output" != '') $output## #else ## Prevent Firefox from inserting bogus whitespace when the text area is empty. ## CKEDITOR-185: Whitespace is generated in Firefox when creating a page without typing the content
